ðŸš¢ R Packages

Our Task

  • To list, evaluate and determine the necessary R packages needed for our Shiny application are supported in R CRAN.

Tackling the task

  • Here, we load up our ship to set sail to work on our project with these R CRAN supported packages.

Packages supported in R CRAN:

Utility Tools Graphing Tools

  • jsonlite - To parse JSON

  • tidyverse - Data science tools

  • ggtext - Tools for text formatting

  • knitr - For better table displays

  • lubridate - For processing date and time

  • hms - For durations

  • scales - For breaks and labels

  • tidytext - For functions text mining

  • tm - For text mining

  • SnowBallC - For Porterâ€™s word stemming

  • SmartEDA - EDA with some graphing

  • reactable - For interactive data tables

  • highcharter- For wrapper function

  • conflicted - For managing namespace conflicts

  • patchwork - For combining ggplot plots

  • ggraph - For plotting network data

  • tidygraph - For graph manipulations

  • igraph - Contains functions for network analysis

  • ggiraph - Interactive plots

  • plotly - Interactive plots

  • wordcloud- For frequency representation of words

  • ggh4x - For axis, strip, and facet customizations

  • visNetwork - For interactive visualisation of networks.

  • RColorBrewer - Colour schemes for graphics

  • circlize - For circular plots

  • ggalluvial - For alluvial diagrams

  • networkD3- For D3-based interactive network graphs

  • leaflet- For interactive maps
  • We will use the code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.
Show the code 
pacman::p_load(jsonlite, tidyverse, ggtext,   
               knitr, lubridate, hms, scales,   
               tidytext, tm, SnowballC,   
               patchwork, ggraph,    
               tidygraph, igraph, ggiraph,    
               SmartEDA, plotly, wordcloud,    
               ggh4x, visNetwork, RColorBrewer, 
               circlize, ggalluvial, reactable,
               networkD3, highcharter, leaflet, conflicted)

ðŸ§° Part of Tidyverse

  • stringr - For wrapping text and string manipulation

  • readr - For reading rectangular data (CSV, TSV, etc)

  • dplyr - For transforming, filtering, summarising data

  • ggplot2 - For building data visualisation

ðŸ”„Workarounds:

These are some workarounds required for Shiny application:

  • magick - For graphics and image processing will be replaced by renderImage() + impageOutput()

  • We will use renderWordcloud2() (from the wordcloud2 package) and wordcloud2Output() in our UI.

ðŸ†šSettle Conflict Issues:

  • conflicts_prefer(shinydashboard::box)
  • conflicts_prefer(dplyr::filter)
  • conflicts_prefer(dplyr::lag)
  • conflicts_prefer(networkD3::JS)
